intro: Stelis jurisdixii, commonly known as the Jurisdixii orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, spiral-shaped inflorescence and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical forests. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Stelis jurisdixii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and unique floral structure.
